member.name: T:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Aggregates.AggregateRoot`1
member.summary: Base class for implementing aggregate root domain objects. No external code should access the internal objects of this Aggregate! So add properties as internal only!

member.name: M:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Aggregates.AggregateRoot`1.#ctor(System.Guid)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Every constructor have to satisfy: GUID. This must be unique in the whole Application.! You should probably extend this constructor to include every property that makes this entity unique.
member.param: Aggregate root instance id.

member.summary: Applies a new domain event to the aggregate root instance.
member.param: The new domain event to apply.

member.name: T:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Entities.Entity`1
member.summary: Base class for any Entity Type (i.e. the 'Entity Object' of DDD). All properties of this child classes should have the setter as private!
member.typeparam: Domain type to be 'turned' into a Entity Type.

member.name: M:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Entities.Entity`1.#ctor(System.Guid,Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Entities.IEntity)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Every constructor have to satisfy: If the entity is not an Aggregate Root, then it cannot be created without passing the owner of this entity (Some entity inside the Aggregate, maybe the Aggregate root)! GUID. This must be unique inside the Aggegate.! You should probably extend this constructor to include every property that makes this entity unique.

member.name: M:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Entities.Entity`1.#ctor
member.summary: It should never be possible to Create an Entity without and ID and an Owner.

summary.c: Exception related to a contract not being fulfilled
Exception related to a contract not being fulfilled
You Should never try to verify validation in the entity. Because the entity should always be valid

member.name: T:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Rules.IDomainRule`2
member.summary: Base interface for Rule Definition. It should receive one Entity as input (TEntity) and return a value as Output (TRuleReturn). This output will be used in the RuleExecutor.

member.name: T:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Utils.Collections.DictionaryByValue`2
member.summary: A dictionary with equality based on its content and not on the dictionary's reference (i.e.: 2 different instances containing the same entries will be equals).
member.remarks: This type is not thread-safe (for hashcode updates).
member.typeparam: The type of keys in the dictionary.
The type of values in the dictionary.

member.name: T:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Utils.Collections.EquallityComparer.EquatableByValue`1
member.summary: Support a by-Value Equality and Unicity.
member.remarks: This latest implementation has been inspired from Scott Millett's book (Patterns, Principles, and Practices of Domain-Driven Design).

member.name: M:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Utils.Collections.EquallityComparer.EquatableByValue`1.GetAllAttributesToBeUsedForEquality
member.summary: Use Yield to define every property used to diferentiate

member.name: T:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Utils.Collections.EquallityComparer.EquatableByValueWithoutOrder`1
member.summary: Support a by-Value Equality and Unicity where order of the elements that belongs to the Unicity/Equality doesn't matter.

member.name: T:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Utils.Collections.ListByValue`1
member.summary: A list with equality based on its content and not on the list's reference (i.e.: 2 different instances containing the same items in the same order will be equals).
member.remarks: This type is not thread-safe (for hashcode updates).

member.name: T:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Utils.Collections.SetByValue`1
member.summary: A Set with equality based on its content and not on the Set's reference (i.e.: 2 different instances containing the same items will be equals whatever their storage order).
member.remarks: This type is not thread-safe (for hashcode updates).

member.name: T:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Utils.Collections.WeakCollection`1
member.summary: A collection of weak references to objects.
member.typeparam: The type of object to hold weak references to.

member.name: F:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Utils.Collections.WeakCollection`1._list
member.summary: The actual collection of strongly-typed weak references.

member.name: M:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Utils.Collections.WeakCollection`1.GetLiveItems
member.summary: Gets a list of live objects from this collection, causing a purge.

member.name: M:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Utils.Collections.WeakCollection`1.Add(`0)
member.summary: Adds a weak reference to an object to the collection. Does not cause a purge.
member.param: The object to add a weak reference to.

member.name: M:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.Utils.Collections.WeakCollection`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes a weak reference to an object from the collection. Does not cause a purge.
member.param: The object to remove a weak reference to.
member.returns: True if the object was found and removed; false if the object was not found.

member.name: T:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.ValueObjects.Enumeration
member.summary: Defines an Enumeration with extra power (it's a class). You can inherit and create new types. Can add properties, etc. So you won't have to use switches. from: https://lostechies.com/jimmybogard/2008/08/12/enumeration-classes

member.name: T:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.ValueObjects.ValueObject`1
member.summary: Base class for any Value Type (i.e. the 'Value Object' oxymoron of DDD). All you have to do is to implement the abstract methods: All of the object properties must have the setter as Private! There should be no empty constructor!
member.typeparam: Domain type to be 'turned' into a Value Type.

member.name: M:Akrual.DDD.Utils.Domain.ValueObjects.ValueObject`1.#ctor
member.summary: The Entity Framework needs an empty constructor. But no Value object should have one.
